title: [C++] [BUG] Adjust offset when the batch size is set for reading
body:
When the Scan node has a batch size smaller than the actual group size, `Take` needs to re-adjust the indices offset to align with the batch it reads. 

Closes #192

title: GH action to upload wheels and also make reusable yml
action to bump version for new release
body:
Proposed release process:

1. top of main should be green
2. manually trigger this action
3. make a github "Release" with the tag created from step 2 above
4. GH to release to pypi should automatically trigger
5. GH to create a new patch release (e.g., v0.1 -> v0.2.dev0) should trigger automatically

title: Cleanup mac wheel
body: current for mac wheel we package way too many libs

title: GH actions for release and testing
body:
- [x] release to pypi
- [x] run benchmark code
- [ ] run doctest
- [x] run notebook

title: Make extension types work on mac
body: The mac build has a separate copy of arrow lib which means the extension registry singleton has 2 instances. Thus extension types cannot be read out.

title: Restore thirdparty arrow build
body: Using the local build currently fails. This makes local devleopment of the python code really inconvenient

title: Exclude filter columns from projection
body: In the case for `dataset.scanner(columns=["foo"], filters=(col("bar") == 1)`, the result should only have column `foo`.

title: [C++] Provide testing utility to create a table from JSON
body:
It is tedious to create nested structures using Arrow C++ APIs. 

In upstream Arrow project, it has testing utility to create Table from JSON string. We should have something similar so that it is easier to write tests.

2. LanceDataset leaves str unconverted in record mode (filter column)

title: Scanner errors / segfault
body:
Setup:

```python
import lance
uri = "s3://eto-public/datasets/oxford_pet/oxford_pet.lance"
ds = lance.dataset(uri)
```

Head works fine:
```python
ds.head(10)
# ds.scanner(limit=10).to_table()
```

Filter alone raises Exception:
```python
In [9]: import pyarrow.compute as pc

In [10]: expr = pc.field("class") == "samoyed"

In [11]: ds.scanner(filter=expr).to_table()
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ArrowIndexError                           Traceback (most recent call last)
Cell In [11], line 1
----> 1 ds.scanner(filter=expr).to_table()

File /mnt/lance/.venv/lance/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyarrow/_dataset.pyx:2577, in pyarrow._dataset.Scanner.to_table()

File /mnt/lance/.venv/lance/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyarrow/error.pxi:144, in pyarrow.lib.pyarrow_internal_check_status()

File /mnt/lance/.venv/lance/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pyarrow/error.pxi:127, in pyarrow.lib.check_status()

ArrowIndexError: FileReader::GetListArray: indices is empty: field=object(15)
```

Filter + Limit causes segfault:
```python
In [12]: ds.scanner(filter=expr, limit=10).to_table()
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

title: Invalid group by over partitioned field
body:
# Problem Statement

We have a partitioned dataset 

```
s3://path/to/oxford_pet.lance
   /train/*.lance
   /eval/*.lance
  ...
```

```python
dataset = lance.dataset(
        "s3://eto-public/datasets/oxford_pet/oxford_pet.lance",
        partitioning=pa.dataset.partitioning(field_names=["split"])
    )
duckdb.query("""
        SELECT
            count(1) as cnt, class, split
        FROM dataset
        GROUP BY 3, 2 ORDER BY class
    """

```

Raises

```
Failed example:
    print(duckdb.query("""
        SELECT
            count(1) as cnt, class, split
        FROM dataset
        GROUP BY 3, 2 ORDER BY class
    """).df())
Exception raised:
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/opt/homebrew/Cellar/python@3.10/3.10.6_2/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.10/lib/python3.10/doctest.py", line 1350, in __run
        exec(compile(example.source, filename, "single",
      File "<doctest default[0]>", line 6, in <module>
        """).df())
    duckdb.InvalidInputException: Invalid Input Error: arrow_scan: get_next failed(): Invalid: Field split dose not exist
```

# Problem Statement

We should auto-maintain the document release process and keep updating the docs.

- Should we use [mkdocs](https://www.mkdocs.org/) or [rst](https://docutils.sourceforge.io/rst.html)?
- Theme? 
- Host service (https://readthedocs.org/)?

title: PyTorch Dataset supports column alias
body:
# Problem Statement

Sometimes, the dataset column names are not the same as what the model expected. For example, in the vanilla torchvision models, they take `<image>, {"labels": tensor[], "boxes": tensors[]}` . 

It would be convenient that we can offer a column mapping for rename / alias when reading PyTorch landed dataset.

# Desired Behavior

```python
dataset = lance.pytorch.LanceDataset(
  "/path/to/coco/dataset", 
   columns={
      "image": "external_image", 
       "labels": "annotations.category_id", 
        "boxes": "annotations.bbox",
}`

```

title: Minor fix for 3d extension types
body: and also some linting

title: Support converting PIL from Image in pytorch Dataset
body: And make a contract that Pytorch Dataset returns numeric values as `torch.Tensor`.

title: Support partitioning and group size control in coco dataset generation.
body: Allow `parse_coco.py` to specify row group size and max rows per file to control the layout of the coco dataset in terms of exposing more parallelisms for the reader.

title: Coco improvements
body:
1. Use ImageType for the 3 url columns
2. Convert the annotations.name column to dictionary array

This will replace #171 until working with extension types are easier

title: Extension type improvements to support 3d types
body:
Support point2d, box 2d/3d


Also added polygon 2d/3d to support segmentation

body: Change some annotations fields to Image/Box2d/Label extension arrays

Note: the raw data uri needs to be updated for local system:
```python
from parse_coco import CocoConverter
c = CocoConverter('/home/chang/Downloads/datasets/coco')
df = c.read_metadata()
table = c.save_df(df, output_path='/tmp/coco_test.lance')

import lance
lance.dataset('/tmp/coco_test.lance').head(1)
```

```

/home/chang/code/eto/lance/cpp/build/liblance.so(_ZN5lance2io4exec7Project4NextEv+0x85)[0x7f35f603ce5f]
/home/chang/code/eto/lance/cpp/build/liblance.so(_ZNK5lance2io17RecordBatchReader9ReadBatchEv+0x56)[0x7f35f602d2f2]
/home/chang/code/eto/lance/cpp/build/liblance.so(+0x366408)[0x7f35f602d408]
/home/chang/code/eto/lance/cpp/build/liblance.so(+0x36745c)[0x7f35f602e45c]
/home/chang/code/eto/lance/cpp/build/liblance.so(+0x367393)[0x7f35f602e393]
/home/chang/code/eto/lance/cpp/build/liblance.so(+0x3672d3)[0x7f35f602e2d3]
/home/chang/code/eto/lance/cpp/build/liblance.so(+0x367212)[0x7f35f602e212]
/home/chang/code/eto/lance/cpp/build/liblance.so(+0x367177)[0x7f35f602e177]
/home/chang/code/eto/lance/cpp/build/liblance.so(+0x367140)[0x7f35f602e140]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libarrow.so.900(+0xda9c90)[0x7f36219b5c90]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6(+0xdc2b3)[0x7f36209732b3]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x94b43)[0x7f362681cb43]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x126a00)[0x7f36268aea00]
[1]    686511 IOT instruction (core dumped)  ipython
```

The problem seems to be that Lance is not writing the nested extension type properly:

```python
from parse_coco import CocoConverter
c = CocoConverter('/home/chang/Downloads/datasets/coco')
df = c.read_metadata()
table = c._convert_metadata_df(df)
table.schema
```

The above shows that `annotations.bbox` has type `list<box2d>` which is as expected.

But once it's written, only the storage type is read:

```python
lance.dataset('/tmp/coco_test.lance').schema
``` 

The above shows that `annotations.bbox` is `list<fixed_size_list<double>>`

This is consistent with the segfault stack trace above showing:

```
./cpp/src/arrow/array/array_nested.cc:191:  Check failed: (self->list_type_->value_type()->id()) == (data->child_data[0]->type->id()) 
```

title: Unable to convert extension type to pandas
body:
```python
import lance
from lance.types import ImageBinaryType
uri = "s3://eto-public/datasets/oxford_pet/oxford_pet.lance"
ds = lance.dataset(uri)
tbl = ds.scanner(columns=["image"], limit=10).to_table()
assert tbl["image"].type == ImageBinaryType()
tbl.to_pandas()
```

Results in following error:

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
KeyError                                  Traceback (most recent call last)
Input In [10], in <cell line: 1>()
----> 1 tbl.to_pandas()

File ~/code/eto/lance/python/thirdparty/arrow/python/pyarrow/array.pxi:823, in pyarrow.lib._PandasConvertible.to_pandas()

File ~/code/eto/lance/python/thirdparty/arrow/python/pyarrow/table.pxi:3913, in pyarrow.lib.Table._to_pandas()

    816 columns = _deserialize_column_index(table, all_columns, column_indexes)
--> 817 blocks = _table_to_blocks(options, table, categories, ext_columns_dtypes)

    820 return BlockManager(blocks, axes)

   1166 columns = block_table.column_names
   1167 result = pa.lib.table_to_blocks(options, block_table, categories,

-> 1169 return [_reconstruct_block(item, columns, extension_columns)
   1170         for item in result]

title: Throw ArrowNotImplementError when creating images array from pandas
body:
# Problem Statement

Reproduce 
```python

 images = download_uris(pd.Series(uris))
 arr = pa.ExtensionArray.from_pandas(images, type=ImageBinaryType())
```

Exceptions

```
  File "/home/lei/work/lance/python/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/click/core.py", line 760, in invoke
    return __callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/lei/work/lance/python/benchmarks/oxford_pet/./datagen.py", line 239, in main
    converter.make_embedded_dataset(
  File "/home/lei/work/lance/python/benchmarks/oxford_pet/../bench_utils.py", line 255, in make_embedded_dataset
    arr = pa.ExtensionArray.from_pandas(images, type=ImageBinaryType())
  File "pyarrow/array.pxi", line 1037, in pyarrow.lib.Array.from_pandas
  File "pyarrow/array.pxi", line 317, in pyarrow.lib.array
  File "pyarrow/array.pxi", line 39, in pyarrow.lib._sequence_to_array
  File "pyarrow/error.pxi", line 144, in pyarrow.lib.pyarrow_internal_check_status
  File "pyarrow/error.pxi", line 121, in pyarrow.lib.check_status
pyarrow.lib.ArrowNotImplementedError: extension
```

Environment :

```
Ubuntu 22.04
Python 3.10
PyArrow 9.0
```

title: Pickle Image
body:
closes #159 

Instead of custom `Image.__new__`, we just have `Image.create` instead

title: Lance.types.Image does not work with Pickle or process.Pool
body:
# Problem Statement

Can not pass Image via `multiprocessing.Pool.map`. 

```python
import lance
from lance.types.image import Image
import multiprocessing

def f(uri: str) -> Image:
    return Image(uri)

pool = multiprocessing.Pool()
pool.map(f, ["s3://abc"])

title: Improve ergonomic of the Pytorch dataset and Generate embeddings for oxford pet

title: Benchmark training over coco dataset
body:
# Problem Statement

Implement a training benchmark for object detection dataset, i.e., `COCO`. 

We can use this benchmark to evaluate the developer experience for MLE to use lance, also, since object detection datasets are usually highly nested, we can test the performance of lance over nested fields (i.e., label / segmentation) as well. 

# Desired Behavior

Use pytorch or Pytorch Ligntning to build a training script, test against: 

* lance / parquet / raw json format
* From Local disk and from S3.
* Data exploration via `duckdb`.

title: Support Writing Manifest externally within the dataset.
body: # Problem Statement Manifest is the metadata that is shared amount the lance files within the same dataset. It could be just stored once, so the FileReader only needs to parse it once when reading an multi-file datasets. Another extra benefit is that the values of dictionary are shared amount files as well, we can store them in the manifest file as well. Here is a profiling work with smaller files (i.e., group size = 128, max_rows_in_file=512, dataset=Oxford Pet) # Desired Behavior We could expect around 3-4x improvements over the above profiling result (by eliminating LoadDictionary and Reduce `FileReader::Open()`

This PR includes the following:

- io utilities (lifted/improved from rikai)

title: Pytorch DataLoader mulit-process support
body:
# Problem Statement

As per Pytorch document

https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/data.html#iterable-style-datasets

> When num_workers > 0, each worker process will have a different copy of the dataset object, so it is often desired to configure each copy independently to avoid having duplicate data returned from the workers. [get_worker_info()](https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/data.html#torch.utils.data.get_worker_info), when called in a worker process, returns information about the worker.

Unsigned indices in dictionaries give error

`ds.column("class").to_numpy()`

Raises exception:

`ArrowTypeError: Converting unsigned dictionary indices to pandas not yet supported, index type: uint8`

title: Add convenience function for limit/offset
body:
Right now to take advantage of Lance performance, we need to explicitly call `lance.scanner(..., limit=20, offset=10)`. It would be nice to be able to do something like `lance.dataset(uri).limit(n=20, offset=10)`.

Note that pyarrow's Dataset already has a `head` method and under the hood it's creating a scanner. BUT, it does not support Lance's scanner and limit/offset options. In addition, pyarrow's Dataset and Scanner are cython cdef classes so cannot be monkey patched.

Options:

1. Create Lance subclasses for FileSystemDatasetFactory and FileSystemDataset (both in C++ and cython) which returns the right scanner and supports more ScanOptions. We would then monkey-patch pyarrow.dataset._filesystem_dataset to use this new factory and dataset.
2. Create cython-only LanceFileSystemDataset with a factory method to create an instance from a FileSystemDataset. Then in `lance.dataset`, call this factory method so `lance.dataset` returns a Dataset that supports `Dataset.head(n=20, offset=10)`, which calls `lance.scanner` under the hood to support lance-specific ScanOptions.

title: Refactor I/O exec nodes
body:
* Reconstruct the I/O execute node to a more standard physical plan, represented by an ExecNode tree.
* Make the Scan node (leaf node) own the logic of batch read.
* Add `Take` node that do random reads based on the indices returned from the `Filter` node.

title: Support pyarrow write_dataset with partitions
body: Closes #122

title: Update python dataset generation to use boolean and dictionary encoding.
Update README.md
Make Lance work with pyarrow.write_dataset API
body:
# Problem Statement

With pyarrow's `write_dataset`, the arrow can take care of partition, chunk size and etc.

https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.dataset.write_dataset.html#pyarrow.dataset.write_dataset

Currently, if we run 

```
    format = lance.LanceFileFormat()
    ds.write_dataset(
        tbl,
        "dir",
        partitioning=["split"],
        format=format,
        file_options=format.make_write_options(),
    )
```

which reports error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/lei/work/sophon/tools/datasets/./bdd100k.py", line 88, in <module>
    data_gen()
  File "/home/lei/work/lance/python/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1130, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/lei/work/lance/python/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1055, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/home/lei/work/lance/python/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1404, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/home/lei/work/lance/python/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/click/core.py", line 760, in invoke
    return __callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/lei/work/sophon/tools/datasets/./bdd100k.py", line 82, in data_gen
    file_options=lance.LanceFileFormat().make_write_options(),
  File "pyarrow/_dataset.pyx", line 826, in pyarrow._dataset.FileFormat.make_write_options
  File "pyarrow/_dataset.pyx", line 724, in pyarrow._dataset.FileWriteOptions.wrap
TypeError: lance
```

As seen here: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/fa33ca400759d4e9912b06df6680bf0199e28fd5/python/pyarrow/_dataset.pyx#L713-L728

# Desired Behavior

Lance can work well with `pyarrow.dataset.write_dataset()` and writes partitioned dataset.

title: Implement a Stream Writer to write RecordBatch iteratively.
body:
# Problem Statement

Giving that with the embedded images, the dataset will be usually very big, we could support a Writer that write data batch by batch.

```python

writer = lance.Writer(uri, schema)
for batch in batches:
    writer.write(batch)

```

```
SELECT id FROM table WHERE id = 10
```

where the filters cover all the projected columns.

title: PlainEncoding uses raw value pointer to write data to disk.
body:
Closes #113.

The reason of the bug was that Arrow re-uses the underneath buffer object for multiple arrays. Each array is with different offsets on the same buffer.  `PlainEncoder` used to write Array::data() which always pointed to the first batch.

title: Appended binary column causes roundtrip to produce incorrect results
body:
In `benchmarks/parse_coco.py`, I read the image bytes and append a `binary` column called "image" to the table and write it.
After I read back the written table, the results are incorrect.

Start in `benchmarks` directory, steps to repro:

# Setup metadata table

```python
from parse_coco import CocoConverter, get_schema
import pyarrow as pa
import lance
import duckdb

c = CocoConverter('/home/chang/Downloads/datasets/coco/')
df = c.read_instances()
tbl = pa.Table.from_pandas(df, get_schema())
```

# Run the label distribution query
```
query = "select ann.name, count(1) from (select unnest(annotations) as ann FROM tbl) group by 1"
duckdb.query(query).to_df()
```

This ^ produces correct results as expected

# Add the binary column
```
tbl = c.make_embedded_dataset(tbl)
duckdb.query(query).to_df()
```

This ^ produces correct results as expected

# Things go awry after roundtrip

```
lance.write_table(tbl, "/tmp/coco.lance")
tbl = lance.dataset("/tmp/coco.lance").to_table()
duckdb.query(query).to_df()
```

This shows only 20 categories rather than the expected 80 categories

In [6]: query = "select distinct image_id from (select image_id, unnest(annotations) as ann from ds) where ann.name == 'cat'"

In [7]: filtered_ids = duckdb.query(query).arrow().column('image_id').to_numpy()

In [8]: scanner = lance.scanner(ds, ['image', 'annotations.name'], filter=pc.field('image_id').isin(filtered_ids), limit=50, offset=20)

In [9]: [1]    148815 segmentation fault (core dumped)  ipython
```

title: Set batch size when writing the file
body: Closes #107

title: Support reading lance into PyTorch
body: We can start to use lance for training and inference.

title: Support Arrow Tensor type
body:
edit: use `arrow::extension::FixedShapeTensorType`

https://arrow.apache.org/docs/dev/format/CanonicalExtensions.html#fixed-shape-tensor-extension


# Problem

In arrow, [Tensors](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/cpp/api/tensor.html) do not have corresponding Array type, as it can not be used to store in a Table / Dataset / RecordBatch.

To support ML datasets, it is desirable to have tensors stored within the datasets.

# Desired Behavior

To support parametrized Tensors in a Table / Datasets. A `TensorArray` and `TensorType` should allow parameters, i.e., `shade`, `data type` (i.e., bid_width) and etc.

```cpp
class TensorType {
   TensorType(data_type, shade, ...)
}
```

title: Allow user to customize batch size in the file
body:
# Problem Statement

Currently, Lance writes an Arrow Table to the disk, and each on-disk batch is the same as each record batch in the table. We should have default value for an optimized size of record batch on disk, optimizing for read.

Parquet has similar value, so is Procella. 

# Desired Behavior

Add a default value to `WriteTable()`:

```python
lance.write_table(table, dest, ..., batch_size=1024)
```

title: Add read/write support for time / datetime types
body:
Add read / write support for

- Timestamp(unit)
- Time32 / Time64
- Date32 / Date64

Closes #98

title: Optimize array read with sparse indices
body:
# Problem Statement

Currently,  when `Lance` reads an list array with the indices is offered, i.e..

```python
indices = [0, 2, 3, 4, 1000000]
```
It reads all the data from `[0, 1000000]`, and apply the indices later, which wastes significant amount of I/O.

# Desired Behavior

We could use some heuristics to optimize the I/O plan, i.e., an ideal plan might be read `[0-4]` and `[1000000:1000001]` in two separate I/Os.
